climb.description: As if there were any doubt, he can even climb in galoshas.
climb.title: Climb

easter01.description: The following series of photos was taken by Sylvie, soon after the Easter Bunny had visited her garden.
easter01.title: Easter 1

easter02.description: For those of you in France, let me try to explain. In America, the Easter eggs come from rabbits. Felix, Evan and Anna don't question the dubious anatomical implications.
easter02.title: Easter 2

easter03.description: Felix loves containers of all types, but baskets filled with goodies top the list.
easter03.title: Easter 3

easter04.description: Now, let's all sit down and take inventory.
easter04.title: Easter 4

easter05.description: Anna gives it more thought... can rabbits really lay eggs?
easter05.title: Easter 5

easter07.description: Another photo scanned from Sylvie. This one was taken a while back... a day at the lake with Robert and Edan.
easter07.title: Easter 7

motorcycle2.description: Maybe if Felix steers and Evan works the clutch...
motorcycle2.title: Motorcycle 2

park1.description: The weather was beautiful this weekend.  We went to Central Park in San Mateo, 20 minutes south of San Francisco.  We hadn't been before but it was lovely.  Here, Lucie takes a brief toddler-free moment to contemplate the Japanese Tea Garden.
park1.title: Park 1

park2.description: The lake has more fish than you can shake a stick at.  We know.  Felix tried to shake a stick at every single fish, and it took a long time.
park2.title: Park 2

park3.description: The park even has a cute miniature train.  Felix doesn't want to go solo, so Dean wedges himself in.
park3.title: Park 3

park4.description:
A sno-cone a deux.

Felix read in a book (I am a Big Brother Now) that babies can't eat fun things like ice cream; they just drink milk. So now, he thinks of ice cream as his big boy right. "Bébé eat bottle; garçon eat glace!"
park4.title: Park 4

zoo1.description:
Lucie and Felix go to the zoo with friends from Phoenix Pop.

From left to right: Felix, Jasper (son of Hazel Sharpe), James (son of Judy Howe), Miles and Alyssa (children of Albert Poon) and, in front, Siena (daughter of Cyndi Tung).
zoo1.title: Zoo 1

zoo2.description:
From left to right: Albert, Lucie, Felix, Hazel, Miles, Alyssa, James, Jasper and Dave (James's dad).

All the kids agreed: the best animal at the zoo is the steam train. Most of the animals at the San Francisco Zoo are pretty lethargic. When Lucie made a comment about it, Felix explained "Sad. Want door open."... a surprising observation; we had never talked about this aspect of zoos. The boy is perceptive.
zoo2.title: Zoo 2

description:
Fruits are in season and Felix is enjoying every juicy bite of it. If we buy mangoes for desert, we have to buy 2: one half for Dean and Lucie to share, and one and a half for Felix to devour. Here is a recent conversation during a car ride:

"- Faim. Eat Something? (faim=hungry)
- J'ai des Cheese Puffs si tu veux. (I have Cheese Puffs, if you'd like)
- No Chee Puff. Apple?
- Non, je n'ai pas de pommes.
- Raisin? (grape)
- Non, non plus
- Abicot?
- Non, pas d'abricots, que des Cheese Puffs.
- Wiwi?
- Désolé, pas de kiwis non plus.
- Fraise? (strawberry)
- Felix, je n'ai aucun fruit dans la voiture.
- Why! Mommy, why!"

Watch a movie of him playing moving truck.
title: May 1
